questions.stem: What is required for portfolio building during the probationary period?

options.text: No portfolio is required during probation
Building a portfolio of case summaries, reflective accounts, and evidence of competence, with supervisor sign-off
Only collecting case numbers
Only supervisor sign-off without evidence

questions.explanation: During the probationary period, PSRs must build a portfolio demonstrating competence. This includes case summaries, reflective accounts of learning and development, evidence of work completed, and supervisor sign-off. The portfolio is submitted as part of the assessment process.

questions.stem: How long is the probationary period for PSRs?

options.text: 6 months
12 months
18 months
24 months

questions.explanation: The probationary period for PSRs is 12 months. During this period, PSRs must work under supervision, are restricted from own-client work, and must build a portfolio. After successful completion of all requirements, they can transition to full registration.
